"S." The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to include a spending limitation for fiscal year 2006 and beyond. Any budget resolution must adhere to this limitation to be considered in the House of Representatives or the Senate. The spending limitation specified in section 1105(i) of title 31, United States Code must be followed in any budget resolution for fiscal year 2006 and beyond. Waiving or suspending this limitation requires a two-thirds affirmative vote in the House of Representatives or the Senate. SEC. 13. REDUCTION OF FICA RATES RESULTING FROM PERSONAL SOCIAL SECURITY SAVINGS PROGRAM. Employee Contribution: Section 3101 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to reduce the tax rate on employees for Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance in years following a reduction year. The reduction year is defined as any year after the transition year when the OASDI rate ratio exceeds 125 percent. The term 'transition year' refers to the first full calendar year after the termination year. The 'reduction percentage' is the difference between the rate in effect for the reduction year and the rate that would result in a 125 percent OASDI rate ratio for that year. The reduction percentage for the reduction year would have been 125 percent if the rate under subsection (a) and section 3111(a) had been applicable, and the rate under section 1401(a) were twice that rate. The OASDI rate ratio is the combined balance in the Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund divided by the amount paid from the Trust Funds for all authorized purposes in a calendar year. The OASDI rate ratio is calculated based on the combined balance in the Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund divided by the amount paid from the Trust Funds for all authorized purposes in a calendar year. The employer contribution section of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new subsection. The tax rate under subsection (a) may be reduced to less than 4.95 percent. Section 3111 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include a new subsection for reducing the tax rate under subsection (a) in certain years. The tax rate under subsection (a) can be reduced to less than 4.95 percent. Section 1401 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include a new subsection for reducing the tax rate under subsection (a) in specific years. The terms 'reduction year' and 'reduction percentage' are defined in section 3101(d). The reduction in the tax rate imposed under subsection (a) shall not cause it to be less than 4.95 percent. The tax rate imposed under subsection (a) can be reduced in specific years by the reduction percentage defined in section 3101(d). The reduction cannot cause the tax rate to be less than 9.9 percent.
